org.daisy.streamline.api.media

Class DefaultFileSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.daisy.streamline.api.media.DefaultFileSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSet, ModifiableFileSet

    public final class DefaultFileSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements ModifiableFileSet
    Provides a default file set.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • copy

        public static DefaultFileSet copy(FileSet source,
                                  BaseFolder target)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new file set at the specified location. All other properties are copied from this file set. Resources are copied to the new file set to the extent possible, see internalizeAllCopy().
        Parameters:
        source - the original file set
        target - the new location, this must point to an existing directory. It is recommended, although not strictly required, that the folder is also empty.
        Returns:
        the created file set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • copy

        public static DefaultFileSet copy(FileSet source,
                                  BaseFolder target,
                                  java.lang.String manifestFileName)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new file set at the specified location. All other properties are copied from this file set. Resources are copied to the new file set to the extent possible, see internalizeAllCopy().
        Parameters:
        source - the original file set
        target - the new location, this must point to an existing directory. It is recommended, although not strictly required, that the folder is also empty.
        manifestFileName - the name of the manifest file. Note that the path to the manifest file cannot be influenced
        Returns:
        the created file set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file name is not valid

      • streamExternal

        public java.util.stream.Stream<AnnotatedFile> streamExternal()
        Description copied from interface: FileSet
        Opens a stream to external resources.
        Specified by:
        streamExternal in interface FileSet
        Returns:
        a stream of external resources

      • internalizeAllCopy

        public void internalizeAllCopy()
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableFileSet
        Copies all external resources into this file set. The resources in this file set will be updated with their new locations. For the copy to succeed, the path to the new location must be a descendant of FileSet.getBaseFolder(). For example, if the resource path starts with .., it will not be processed. See also, ModifiableFileSet.internalizeBelow(Path).
        Specified by:
        internalizeAllCopy in interface ModifiableFileSet

      • internalizeBelow

        public void internalizeBelow(java.nio.file.Path base)
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableFileSet
        Moves all resources located in the specified directory into this file set's base location. Resources in this file set will be update with the new locations. For the move to succeed, the path to the new location must be a descendant of FileSet.getBaseFolder(). For example, if the resource path starts with .., it will not be processed. See also, ModifiableFileSet.internalizeAllCopy().
        Specified by:
        internalizeBelow in interface ModifiableFileSet
        Parameters:
        base - the directory

      • internalizeCopy

        public boolean internalizeCopy(java.lang.String path)
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableFileSet
        Internalizes the specified file set path by copying the original resource into the file set. For the copy to succeed, the path to the new location must be a descendant of FileSet.getBaseFolder(). For example, if the resource path starts with .., it will not be processed. See also, ModifiableFileSet.internalize(String).
        Specified by:
        internalizeCopy in interface ModifiableFileSet
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        true if the file was successfully internalized, false otherwise

      • internalize

        public boolean internalize(java.lang.String path)
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableFileSet
        Internalizes the specified file set path by moving the resource from its current location into the file set. For the move to succeed, the path to the new location must be a descendant of FileSet.getBaseFolder(). For example, if the resource path starts with .., it will not be processed. See also, ModifiableFileSet.internalizeCopy(String).
        Specified by:
        internalize in interface ModifiableFileSet
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        true if the file was successfully internalized, false otherwise
